author: Alyson Krueger
title: From Cooking to Sailing, ‘Summer Camps’ for Adults
text:
When Lynne Bolduc, a 40-year-old legal executive in New York City, needed a vacation in May, she didn’t book a trip to an island paradise or an exotic city — she enrolled in a four-day cooking boot camp at the Culinary Institute of America, about two hours north in Hyde Park.
She spent hours with acclaimed chefs on subjects like how to make the perfect onion soup, testing out her new knowledge in a state-of-the-art kitchen and preparing multicourse meals under strict deadlines. Even meals at the institute’s restaurants were spent analyzing flavors.
Despite all that focus, this was, in fact, a real vacation for Ms. Bolduc. Cooking, she said, “is something I really, really enjoy, and I got to focus on it for four days without thinking about work. It really gives you a better mental break, I would say, than sitting on a beach. I felt really refreshed when I came back.”
